newsitem.title: DENMARK: Denmark to balance public spending in 97 - Jelved.
newsitem.headline: Denmark to balance public spending in 97 - Jelved.

text.p: Danish Economy Minister Marianne Jelved reiterated on Thursday the government's target of achieving balance in public sector expenditure in 1997.

"The government intends to see public expenditure balance in 1997. It is a necessary requirement to allow Denmark to begin paying off its large public debt," Jelved said in her ministry's latest economic report published on Thursday.
"There is a good foundation for Denmark to continue the recent years' positive economic development," she said.
Denmark's economy ministry said in its report it expected public sector expenditure to show a deficit of 15.3 billion crowns at the end of 1996.
The forecast, published in the latest ministry economic review compared with a May 1996 prediction of a 12.0 billion crown shortfall, down on the actual 1995 deficit of 16.2 billion crowns.
